content.description: This is the Regular Route (5.4) described in Squeezing the Lemmon. Climb easy but mostly unprotected, up the left side of the west face of Nancy's Thumb.
content.protection: Not much.  I give it a star for having a perfect Pink Tricam placement.  There are no chains at the top as Squeezing the Lemmon indicates, but a good crack for cams.  Rap off the chains on the far side (closest to the trail).
content.location: The start is a high step and is considerably harder if you are short.

climbs.name: Ben There, Dun That
climbs.fa: Tim Lee, Keith Powell, Mary Jones, and Ben Burnham

content.description: This route is on the West face of Nancy's Thumb Tower, a 30'-high block on top of the East side of North Fin. Follow the only vertical crack up the right side of the face to the two-bolt chain anchors above. The climbing through the crack is easy, though airy as you glance to your right. The final moves near the bolt are awkward.
content.protection: A 3-3.5 Friend and a handful of small to medium nuts or tricams. A quickdraw for the solitary bolt. Chain anchors on top.

content.description: Nancy's Thumb is the large tower protruding from the north end of North Fin.
